statement.p: The pressure \displaystyle{P} (in kilopascals), volume \displaystyle{V} (in liters), and temperature \displaystyle{T} (in kelvins) of a mole of an ideal gas are related by the equation \displaystyle{P}{V}={8.31}{T}. Find the rate at which the volume is changing when the temperature is \displaystyle{315} K and increasing at a rate of \displaystyle{0.05} K/s and the pressure is \displaystyle{24} and increasing at a rate of \displaystyle{0.01} kPa/s.
Round your answer to the nearest hundredth.
